body.name: ID-COOLING SL240 CPU Liquid Cooler with Display, Customizable 2.1" LCD Display for Images or Performance Metrics, 240mm AIO Cooler, Dual AF127 ARGB Fans, Fits Intel/AMD
body.merchantInfo: Sold by ID-COOLING and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 14 hrs 32 mins
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 14 hrs 32 mins
features: 【Premium AIO Cooler】A premium liquid CPU cooler for gaming and high-performance computing systems with a personalized LCD display.
【2.1" LCD Dashboard】Customize your own images, GIFs, MP4 or performance metrics on a 2.1" LCD dashboard with 480x480 resolution.
【Customize & Control】The space software enables you to switch between a variety of display options such as fan speeds, CPU temps, images, GIFs, MP4 and more.
【Aesthetic Appeal】A premium AIO cooler can blend seamlessly into many PC cases, especially those with black or dark-colored interiors.
【ARGB Lighting】The ARGB lighting on the pump and fans ensures vibrant lighting effects to your PC builds.
【Powerful Pump】The upgraded pump provides powerful and low-noise cooling for your CPU. | Pump Speed: 0 - 2500RPM±10%
【FDB Fans】The two AF127 fans equipped with FDB bearings provide quieter operation and stable performance output.
【Extreme Cooling】The 120mm case fan delivers improved air pressure and airflow for extreme cooling. | Max. Air Pressure: 2.68mmH2O | Max. Air Flow: 78CFM
【Simple Cable Management】The fans connect each device to the next with its daisy chain connector, this can reduce clutter and make cable management simpler.
【Compatibility】The CPU liquid cooler can work with Intel & AMD sockets like Intel LGA2066/2011/1700/1200/1151/1150/1155/1156 and AMD AM4/AM5

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars New AIO line from ID-Cooling. Stellar performance, easy-to-use software, and unbeatable pricing
reviews.reviewText: Competing with brands like NZXT and Corsair, this new AIO line from ID-Cooling is going to give those manufacturers a run for their money.AIOs come with mounting hardware for AM4, AM5, LGA1200 and LGA1700. Instructions are straightforward, and mounting hardware is great quality.Individual ARGB fan and AIO cables, each with a splitter to daisy-chain ARGB devices, no included fan or ARGB hub.Cooling performance was on par with or better than NZXT and Corsair models due to the slightly larger than average 27mm AIO fans.Overall I give this 5/5 stars and have ordered many more of these, glad to have competition in the market.This is not a paid or sponsored ad.R5 Custom PCs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good for the price!!
reviews.reviewText: It's a really good AIO once you actually figure out how to install it. CPU runs pretty cool the highest temps I've seen are about 45 C and that's when playing games. I will say the pump was a bit noisy when I first installed it but after running my computer for a bit that noise went away. I mean if you comparing this to something like a NZXT Kraken 240. IMO this ID cooling AIO is the better deal, it got a larger display and the temps are pretty similar. I didn't give it 5 stars because the installation guide was not good, box did not have warranty info (had to go to their official website to check) and no directions for the install of the AIO display software (again went to ID Cooling's official site to download that as well). Other than that I didn't experience any of the issues like some of the other reviews have, all in all a solid AIO.

reviews.reviewerName: Great AIO for the primero and good build quality!
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best bang for your buck 👏
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. It's a great AIO pretty good quality for the price not to noisy the ARGB its not super bright so if your looking for something more colorful it's not for you but performance wise it's great keeps temps around 29 Celsius and 40 while gaming pretty impressive value for your money it's OK point 👉 it's a mustThe 240 fit pretty well on my mid-sized case and the appearance is on point don't let this one go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Noisy Pump Otherwise Solid AIO (UPDATED 4 Day Experience)
reviews.reviewText: Installled it and let it run for 3 days under varying loads but it sounds like a cricket constantly. Efficient cooling otherwise and quiet fans. I love the fan ring design of this, but this was built to be a quiet machine and the crickets break that intent.Update: On the 4th day it just completely stopped working. The cricket noises were the pump already struggling to exist and it gave it out quickly then. Zero RPM reporting to the motherboard sensor or noise coming from the unit now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great aio has been keeping cpu temps below 60° on Ryzen 9 5900x and easy install and program is easy to run.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Poor installation instructions
reviews.reviewText: I wish there’s a better video or detailed written instructions on where all the wire connections go

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This thing is pretty but loud
reviews.reviewText: First off I love the look and functionality of this AIO. Fits my theme perfectly. Love how you can put whatever picture you want, as long as it's the correct format, and can even load in gifs. I like the options it gives you for what you can monitor, but sadly I can't get it to read GPU temp. It recognizes that it's there, but can't get any data unfortunately.But, this thing whines like the supercharger on my A7. It has gotten quieter since initial install, I don't know if like some lube in a motor bearing needs to be moved around, air trapped in the pump originally, not sure. As of right now, when you turn the PC on it has a split second whine of the pump whipping up then goes away, and you can hear it gurgling if you put your head close to the glass (my PC is on the floor). At PC idle you can slightly hear the gurgle, but when the fans spin up from a game, that noise drowns it out. Has me a bit worried about the longevity of the pump, I might try reaching out to ID Cooling. Also I probably should have taken a video.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Working Well Cooling an Intel i9 12400K 13gen
reviews.reviewText: Replaced my Air Cooler for this AIO Cooler and temps dropped significantly.I probably should have bought the 3 fan model, considering I have an i9 13gen, since those are known to run hot, but this one is keeping temps well within range, so there is really no need as of this review. The screen is sharp and the firmware/app supporting it has abundant features, including rotating the screen based on how you installed the head, so the display is always upright.Highly recommend this AIO, as well as the ID-Cooling Brand. I have also used their Air coolers, and those are equally high quality and good performing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I decided to give this AIO a shot over other named brands, and not just because of the price. For the money it's great value. You get a big water block, and LCD screen with full customisation options for videos or pictures. The fans are really quite, even when set to full power (for test purposes) and the installation instructions are easy to follow.
